column5: One of the things that I've devoted some time to is the saga of the aurora trout. There's really not a whole lot published on these fish and I was very excited to be able to reprint something that I don't think anyone has seen in a very long time, an actual story about a fishing expedition into the wilds of Ontario 70 years ago to find these elusive fish.  It really is a great read about how persistent these US visitors were. The story is a nice long read and if anyone is interested there's a link below. (I even threw in a couple of vintage ads to set the mood!)  http://www.auroratro...Trout-Trip.html
That was an awesome find TJ.  Thanks for popping that up.
very high on my bucket list, maybe just maybe this year
Where can a discerning angler acquire a GEP-ROD with a tenite grip??? It's better than ever. Man, we have always been bombarded with clever marketing ploys.
they are very close to fang  , i will be there when season opens.. :
Nice read Ive been twice now and haven't had a touch either time. To far to travel Ive decided that at the time of the year they are open I'd rather musky fish.
